meanings.definition: In a manner that produces or involves many sounds simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirped polyphonously in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played polyphonously, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock rang polyphonously, waking up the entire household.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell polyphonously on the roof, creating a soothing symphony.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled polyphonously through the trees, creating a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to produce or involve many sounds simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The polyphonous instrument filled the room with rich music.
meanings.sent2: The choir's polyphonous voices blended perfectly in the performance.
meanings.sent3: The polyphonous speaker captivated the audience with his diverse range of tones.
meanings.sent4: The polyphonous nature of the forest echoed with various animal calls.
meanings.sent5: The polyphonous nature of the city streets created a cacophony of sounds.
